snippet: During a court-martial on Monday, a prosecutor said Pfc. Bradley Manning put sensitive information into enemy hands, while his defense lawyer said his client had been “naïve.”
abstract: Court-martial of Pfc Bradley Manning, whose secret release of vast archive of military and diplomatic materials put WikiLeaks into international spotlight, opens with dueling portrayals; prosecutor says Manning is traitor who put sensitive information into enemy hands, while his defense lawyer insists his client had been 'naive.'

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: During a court-martial on Monday, a prosecutor said Pfc. Bradley Manning put sensitive information into enemy hands, while his defense lawyer said his client had been “naïve.”

headline.seo: Trial Portrays Two Sides Private in WikiLeaks Case
headline.main: Trial Portrays Two Sides of Private in Leak Case
headline.print_headline: Trial Portrays Two Sides Of Private In Leak Case
